opendial.bn.distribs.discrete

Class CategoricalTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.distribs.discrete.CategoricalTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DiscreteDistribution, IndependentProbDistribution, ProbDistribution

    public class CategoricalTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements DiscreteDistribution, IndependentProbDistribution
    Simple probability distribution represented as a probability table. The table assumes that the distribution is discrete and does not contain any conditional variables, and can therefore be expressed as P(X1,..., Xn).
    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-03-20 20:28:23 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface opendial.bn.distribs.ProbDistribution

      Constructs a new probability table, with no values

      Constructs a new probability table with a mapping between head variable assignments and probability values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CategoricalTable

        public CategoricalTable()
        Constructs a new probability table, with no values

      • CategoricalTable

        public CategoricalTable(java.util.Map<Assignment,java.lang.Double> headTable)
        Constructs a new probability table with a mapping between head variable assignments and probability values. The construction assumes that the distribution does not have any conditional variables.
        Parameters:
        headTable - the mapping to fill the table

      • CategoricalTable

        public CategoricalTable(Assignment uniqueValue)
        Create a categorical table with a unique value with probability 1.0.
        Parameters:
        uniqueValue - the unique value for the table

    • Method Detail

      • addRow

        public void addRow(Assignment head,
          double prob)
        Adds a new row to the probability table, assuming no conditional assignment. If the table already contains a probability, it is erased.
        Parameters:
        head - the assignment for X1...Xn
        prob - the associated probability

      • incrementRow

        public void incrementRow(Assignment head,
                double prob)
        Increments the probability specified in the table for the given head assignment. If none exists, simply assign the probability.
        Parameters:
        head - the head assignment
        prob - the probability increment

      • addRows

        public void addRows(java.util.Map<Assignment,java.lang.Double> heads)
        Add a new set of rows to the probability table.
        Parameters:
        heads - the mappings (head assignment, probability value)

        Parameters:
        head - head assignment

      • isWellFormed

        public boolean isWellFormed()
        Returns true if the probability table is well-formed. The method checks that all possible assignments for the condition and head parts are covered in the table, and that the probabilities add up to 1.0f.
        Specified by:
        isWellFormed in interface ProbDistribution
        Returns:
        true if the table is well-formed, false otherwise
